availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Mobley (Harris County, Georgia, attorney and secretary of the Georgia senate)

body.p: Harris County, Georgia, attorney and secretary of the Georgia Senate. Georgia native. Married Matilda K. Henry in Harris County on September 17, 1846. Father of Reuben Mobley, Sallie Mobley, Mary E. Mobley, J.H. Mobley, John Mobley, and Tabulah Mobley. Attorney in Harris County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Harris County in 1850. Attorney in Harris County in 1860. Owned twenty-seven enslaved person in Harris County in 1860. Secretary of Georgia Senate in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Georgia, Harris County, Hamilton, p. 150.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Georgia, Harris County, Hamilton, p. 385.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Georgia, Harris County, Georgia Militia District 672, p. 532.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Georgia, Harris County, Hamilton, p. 184.
Georgia, Marriage Records From Select Counties, 1828-1978, Harris County Marriages, The Georgia Archives, Morrow, Georgia, p. 34.
Find A Grave, "James M. Mobley (February 11, 1823-May 10, 1903)," Memorial #22420483, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22420483 (accessed January 26, 2020).
